videos.title: Grinduro California 2018 - Quincy
videos.description:
Grinduro 2018 is in the history books now, and thanks to everyone who attended, it was the biggest and best Grinduro yet! From riding along the 60-mile course to jumping in the Swim Hole, to the art galleries, to the gourmet food, afterparty and more, we hope you enjoyed an amazing weekend in Quincy while making new friends, strengthening your #partytoraceratio and #maxinandrelaxin' — we certainly did!

All participation and support of Grinduro means that the Sierra Buttes Trail Stewardship will continue their good work in the Sierra, creating trails and jobs that will help bring even more stoke to riders around the world for years to come!

None of the good times or amazing work would be possible without the help of Grinduro's sponsors and supporters. Big thanks to Giro, SRAM, Fabric, WTB and Lauf, as well as the staff and volunteers of Sierra Buttes Trail Stewardship, and all of our expo partners. We thrive as a family and we couldn't be represented by better brands and people.

videos.title: Grinduro Quincey CA 2025
videos.description:
I raced Grinduro in Quincy this weekend—the full 50-mile gravel grinder, up Mount Hough. The weather was perfect: clear blue skies with just a few clouds.

The course was a mix of fire road climbs through pine forest and long single-track descents. Higher up, we passed through burned sections where only the blackened skeletons of trees remain. The singletrack was dramatic—cut tight into the side of the mountain with sweeping alpine views across the valley. Fast, technical, and a real upper-body workout on a gravel bike.

My race was shaped by flats. Four in total. The trouble began when I misjudged a bunny hop over one of the water channels cut across the fire road. I landed the rear wheel hard, dinged the rim, and the tyre started threatening to unseat itself. After two stops to reseat it, I put in a spare tube—only to find the spare tube already punctured from sitting too long in my saddle bag. A patch held briefly before failing, and later I picked up a thorn puncture for good measure. Too much time fixing tyres meant I fell back through the field and missed the last timed stage, but I still got around the full course.

Despite that, it was a brilliant ride. My new Redshift suspension stem and seatpost both did their job. No saddle sores, even on a rough course and I was able to achieve a new power record. The new Silca saddle bag was discreet and rattle-free. On the downside, I think I’ve put a buckle in the rear wheel.

Camping in Quincy wasn’t my preference, but it worked out fine. A new sleeping bag was warm and comfortable, even with heavy dew soaking the outside of the tent and bag in the morning. I only camped Friday night—packing up dry on Saturday evening meant I avoided dealing with a wet tent.

Dinner was sociable. I met Rich, from the Bay Area, riding an Ibis Ripley he was considering buying. He’s planning to do the Bovine Classic in a couple of weeks on his Stigmata. I also chatted with Pierre, from Houston via Paris, who owns a collection of custom frames, including two Mosaic titanium builds.

Fifty miles and 7,500 feet of climbing made for a hard day out, but Grinduro delivered: big climbs, amazing singletrack, stunning scenery, and a proper adventure—even if I did spend too much of it with a pump in hand.

videos.title: Grinduro 2025: Return to Form
videos.description:
This year Grinduro returned to its roots in idyllic Quincy, CA, where it felt small in all the right ways. I got to spend quality time with some of my favorite bike buds and the entire event really felt like a throwback to those special early days at the Plumas-Sierra County Fairgrounds. It wasn’t a nostalgia trip — I think everyone there would acknowledge that we’ve all changed. The world has changed. But we showed up this weekend with the desire to recapture that old magic. Like all successful magical acts, all you have to do is believe in it enough to make it come true. Thank you for being magic, Grinduro. 

I rode my new Sklar SuperSomething loaded with a gucci bleep-bloop build kit featuring SRAM Force AXS 13-speed, DT Swiss GRC Dicut wheels, Ritchey Venturemax bars, SimWorks Rhonda stem, Sklar titanium seatpost, and Maxxis Rambler 700x50 tires.
